qas.question: What did Paul VI want to keep open with the modern world and people from all walks of life?
How many days after Paul VI election did he announce he would continue the Vatican II?
On what date was Vatican II re convened?
Six days after he was elected, what did Paul VI announce he would continue?
What did Paul want to reform as a newly elected pope?

context: After his election as Bishop of Rome, Paul VI first met with the priests in his new dioceses. He told them that in Milan he started <a0_0>a dialogue<a0_0/> with the modern world and asked them to seek contact with all people from all walks of life. <a1_0>Six<a1_0/> days after his election he announced that he would continue <a3_0>Vatican II<a3_0/> and convened the opening to take place on <a2_0>29 September<a2_0/> 1963. In a radio address to the world, Paul VI recalled the uniqueness of his predecessors, the strength of Pius XI, the wisdom and intelligence of Pius XII and the love of John XXIII. As "his pontifical goals" he mentioned the continuation and completion of Vatican II, the reform of the <a4_0>Canon Law<a4_0/> and improved social peace and justice in the world. The Unity of Christianity would be central to his activities.
